Name: Reinforced concrete flat slabs drop panel or drop capital- columns without shear reinforcing  0<Vg/Vo<0.4, no continuity reinf

GeneralInformation.Description: Costing is on a per joint basis
GeneralInformation.Author: John Wallace
GeneralInformation.Notes: Fragilities were based on judgment due to lack of test data.  The only available data were from a specimen that was constructed using ACI 318-89

DamageStates.Description: Yield strain of the slab flexural reinforcement has been exceeded.  Spalling of concrete may or may not occur.  Slab exhibits large enough crack widths to allow epoxy injection.
DamageStates.RepairMeasures: Remove furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and plumping systems (as necessary) 5 feet either side of damaged area.  Replace and repair finishes.  Replace furnishings, ceilings and mechanical, electrical and plumping systems (as necessary).

DamageStates.Description: Punching occurs causing significant spalling of concrete.
DamageStates.RepairMeasures: Shore damaged area in the two stories below. Remove 100 square feet of concrete slab per column, preserving the slab reinforcement; lap splice 30 new 10 foot long rebar with existing rebar; place formwork; recast concrete slab; remove forms, replace and repair finishes; replace furnishings, ceilings, mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems. Cracks wide enough to be grouted are included in the portion of slab to be demolished and recast.
